To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight Principall secretary to her Ma
tie
.

7
th
April 1589 From M
r
Bodeley

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. I am often solicited
by [cipher symbol for
Sir Thomas Morgan
] to geve him some assistaunce againste injurie of e Capteyns at are w
t
him: wherin
I will not faile in
at degree
at I am able.
But I have bin told by this councell in open
assembly that [cipher symbol for
Lord Willoughby
] hath a strong party in
e towne,
whiche will never be but pervers, and practise
against him, unles
ei be spoken to from whome.
I doe not open
e mater further, for that I thinke
I may presume,
at both yo
w
knowe it from
himself,
and
as yo
r
health shall permitt, will take
some course to reforme it: whiche was never
more necessary, then it is at this present: for
that
e ennemie waiteth for suche opportunities
of domesticall discord. Astouching
e siege
of
Gertrudenbergh,
and
e principall accidents,
I assure my self
at yo
r
H. is made acquainted
by my
L. Treasuro
r
,
and therfore desiring no-
thing more earnestly of God, then yo
r
H. reco-
very of yo
r
strength and welfare, I take my
humble leave. From
e Hage. A
p
7. 89
Yo
r
H most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
